Main Page   Modules   Compound List   File List   Compound Members   File Members  

"cell_" A smart union datatype

T_cell:: can store and print a variety of data, allowing for flexible storage, such as is useful in an array. More...

Defines

#define CELL_SET_CASE(cell, dtype, ctype, data)
#define CELL_ZPRINTF_TRY(pz, pfmt, data, ret, try_len)
#define CELL_ZPRINTF(pz, pfmt, data, ret)
#define CELL_DO_ZPRINT_CASE(pz, fmt, cell, dtype, ret)
#define CELL_DO_ZPRINT_CASE_ZSTRING(pz, fmt, cell, ret, tstr)

Variables

T_cell_fmt g_cell_fmt_default
T_cell_class g_cell_class

Detailed Description

T_cell:: can store and print a variety of data, allowing for flexible storage, such as is useful in an array.

Define Documentation

#define CELL_DO_ZPRINT_CASE (  pz,
fmt,
cell,
dtype,
ret    ) 
 

Value:

case CELL_##dtype:                              \
                CELL_ZPRINTF(pz,fmt->dtype,cell->data.dtype,ret);\
                break;
A generic sprintf macro for T_cells:: except ZSTRING

#define CELL_DO_ZPRINT_CASE_ZSTRING (  pz,
fmt,
cell,
ret,
tstr    ) 
 

Value:

case CELL_ZSTRING:                                      \
                tstr = zstring_get(cell->data.ZSTRING);         \
                CELL_ZPRINTF(pz,fmt->ZSTRING,tstr,ret); \
                break;
A generic sprintf macro for T_cells:: of type ZSTRING

#define CELL_SET_CASE (  cell,
dtype,
ctype,
data    ) 
 

Value:

case CELL_##dtype:                              \
                cell->data.dtype = *(ctype *)data;      \
                cell->type = CELL_##dtype;              \
                break;
A define to simplify setting the T_cell:: fields except ZSTRING

#define CELL_ZPRINTF (  pz,
pfmt,
data,
ret    ) 
 

Value:

{                       \
        if ( pfmt ) {                                           \
                CELL_ZPRINTF_TRY(pz,pfmt,data,ret,16);          \
                if ( ret > 16 ) {                               \
                        CELL_ZPRINTF_TRY(pz,pfmt,data,ret,ret); \
                }                                               \
        } else {                                                \
                ret = 0;                                        \
        }                                                       \
}
snprintf into a zstring. Adaptively resize the zstring until the snprintf fits

#define CELL_ZPRINTF_TRY (  pz,
pfmt,
data,
ret,
try_len    ) 
 

Value:

{               \
        zstring_alloc(pz,try_len);                              \
        ret = snprintf((char *)zstring_get(pz),try_len+1,pfmt,data);    \
}
Try to snprintf with the given length

Function Documentation

T_cell* cell_create_array (  size_t    num ) 
 

Array creator for T_cell::

Since the "uninitialized" type is 0, we simply calloc to create

Parameters:
num  the number of T_cell:: to create
Returns:
the array of T_cell:: created

void cell_destroy_array (  T_cell *    cell_array,
size_t    num
) 
 

Destructor for arrays of cells

WARNING: num must match the number passed to the creator

int cell_fprintf (  T_cell *    c,
FILE *    out,
T_cell_fmt *    fmt
) 
 

fprintf the cell to the given FILE

Parameters:
c  the cell to fprintf
out  the file to write
fmt  the cell format to use, or NULL for to use T_cell_class::fmt
Returns:
the return value fprintf

T_cell* cell_set (  T_cell *    c,
T_cell_type    type,
const void *    data
) 
 

Sets the value

Parameters:
c  the cell to set (if NULL, function is NOOP)
type  the type of data
data  the address of the data to store (except for type VOID where the parameter is the data to store). ZSTRING are copied into a T_zstring::.
Returns:
the cell itself (can be NULL)
Note: changing a cell from type ZSTRING destroys the T_zstring:: referenced do not keep a pointer to the T_zstring:: in your own code.

int cell_sprintf (  T_cell *    c,
T_zstring *    z,
T_cell_fmt *    fmt
) 
 

sprintf the cell to the passed zstring using the given fmt structure Note: will alloc zstring as needed.

Parameters:
c  the cell to sprintf
z  the T_zstring:: to hold the result (automatically resized)
fmt  the cell format to use, or NULL for to use T_cell_class::fmt
Returns:
the return value sprintf (number of characters formatted)

Variable Documentation

T_cell_class g_cell_class
 

Initial value:

 {
        .fmt            = &g_cell_fmt_default
}
The class object for T_cell::

T_cell_fmt g_cell_fmt_default
 

Initial value:

 {
        .DOUBLE         = "% lg",
        .LONG           = "%ld",
        .ULONG          = "%lu",
        .LONGLONG       = "%Ld",
        .ULONGLONG      = "%Lu",
        .VOID           = "0x%08lx",
        .ZSTRING        = "%s"
}
default print formats

These formats defined the output for T_cell:: fields.
